oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 02B ]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as the Arcade, the Stahlman Building, Fourth National Bank, Rhea Building, Nashville Trust Company, Bruce Building, First National Bank, G.H. Beasley Company, the Pentecostal Mission, the Maxwell House, Utopia Hotel, Corner Realty, Nashville Athletic Club, American National Bank, Nashville Banner, American Property Company, Cumberland Presbyterian Publishing Company, Mecklenberg Real Estate Company, Gray and Dudley Hardware Company, Nashville Machine Company, Stewart and Bruckner Company, Brandon Printing Company, Phillips and Buttorff Manufacturing Company, and Enterprise Soap Works. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 100 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
